job.title: Driver - Clothing Pickups | Casual
job.description:
CLOTHING PICKUPS

We are looking for employees with 2 years driving experience in cube van jobs.

  • Picking up clothing from donation bins and residential homes
  • Distribution of collected donations
  • This position is 70% loading and unloading
  • The driving time varies depending on the route.

RATE: $19.11 per collective agreement  PLUS 10.2% in lieu of benefits

Overview

The Truck Driver ensures an efficient and timely pick-up of donated goods and materials thereby assisting to provide a cost effective service, a positive impression to the public and one that promotes the goals of the Association. The Truck Driver navigates through the GVRD region for pickups/drop offs in a cube van with 18 ft. box. The person in this position is also expected to drive throughout the Lower Mainland, placing donation bins at various locations. Tasks between driving and placing donation bins will be assigned on an as needed basis.

Union membership (BCGEU) is required. Successful casual drivers may apply as an internal applicant for available full-time positions which include great benefits. 

Requirements

  • Grade 12 or Secondary School equivalent.
  • Experience and demonstrated skill driving a cube van (18 foot box).
  • Excellent geographical knowledge of the Lower Mainland, Fraser Valley, Tri-cities, and Sea to Sky Region.
  • Physical fitness is an asset.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Criminal Record Clearance
  • Medical Clearance
  • Satisfactory Driver’s Abstract
  • Class 5 Driver's License
  • Demonstrated competency in English
  • Basic computer literacy
  • Eligible to work in Canada

TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION: Please follow the link: 

https://www.develop.bc.ca/about-us/careers/driver-casual/

For more information, please visit our website at www.develop.bc.ca

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

job.title: Junior Designer/Tradeshow Exhibit structures
job.description:
ATTENTION: Industrial/structural Designers  (not graphic designers)


If you have a flair for getting people's attention through the use of visual dynamics, with an industrial design or experience with trade show exhibit design, then we need to talk.

We’re CTM Exhibits Worldwide, a leading TRADESHOW Exhibit business in need of energetic, positive, team players with a technical aptitude and creative flair to join our in-house exhibit design department. You will be working with our sales and creative teams to design and produce client exhibits, full color renderings, and some graphic layouts with emphasis first and foremost on the exhibit design.

Requirements:
2 - 3 years experience in Broad Spectrum Industrial/Structural Design and implementation – entailing tradeshow exhibit design as well as some limited graphic design and production. Main focus and concentration is on the structural design. (Structural meaning structures such as tradeshow exhibits - stand alone full sized units)

Programs used are Vectorworks, Render Works,, ArtLantis  Cad, Auto Cad, Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop. Strong knowledge and/or proficiency with the above products are a definite asset. A willingness to spend your personal time to learn the software is also an asset.

This position is available immediately for daytime work.  

To find out more about this exciting career in a recession proof industry, please submit your resume with salary expectations & sample portfolio via e-mail to ssomers@telus.net.

Please note - if your experience lies only in Graphic Design, your applicaton will not be considered.

job.title: B2B Sales Assistant / Inside Sales/Business Development
job.description:
Your outgoing and friendly, yet professional personality is what will make you successful in this B2B environment.  We are seeking an outgoing, go get'em attitude type person to assist in B2B sales by performing lead followup, customer enquiries, inside sales, preparing quotes and offering customer service. We are a fast paced, fast growing manufacturing company in the tradeshow industry. Candidate must be a highly organized, energetic, outgoing person who enjoys offering exceptional customer service, answering client's enquiries, being on the phone and searching the internet. You will be required to assist our sales department with research, lead generation, sales, quotes and customer service. Research aspect using the internet and calling from our existing database as well as newly generated lists resulting from the internet research. Networking and tradeshow attendance is a perk for the right candidate. Encumbent must have a background in business to business sales with emphasis on lead/business development and have strong communication skills while showing initiative and perserverance for project success. Position requires excellent proficiency with the English language, both written and verbal, computer skills using a Microsoft Office Environment, internet and database proficiency. Experience with CRM database, preparing and presenting quotations and closing are assets considered.

Located in Richmond, BC, regular hours Monday to Friday 8:00 - 5:00. .

Please submit resume via e-mail - no phone calls please.
